page.title: 06ST. MICHAEL'S LAMPLUGH
page.content: St. Michael's church is one of the churches in the parish of Lamplugh with Ennerdale. There has been a church on the site for 800 years. The present church is a 100 years old. There are about 25 people working for the church. They include 12 sidesmen, 1 cleaner, 1 grave digger, 1 vicar, 2 organists and 1 grasscutter. There is one service every week and it lasts 1 hour. About 16 people come each time unless there is a wedding or a funeral. The Reverand Simpson works in Lamplugh, Kirkland and Ennerdale church. There isn't a choir unless there is a very special occasion. The members of the church take it in turns to put flowers in the church.
